pullRequest.title: Issue #4683 Fix jetty-slf4j-impl for osgi
pullRequest.bodyText:
Closes #4683
The new jetty-slf4j-impl had the wrong manifest entries so it didn't work in osgi.  Fixed the manifest, and took the opportunity to rationalize the logging that is done by the osgi tests: they now all share common code, and the log levels are configurable from the command line to ease debugging.  As part of this work I also upgraded the bndlib version (only used for testing).  I've also started a README.txt file in jetty-osgi/test-jetty-osgi  to explain how the test work and how to control the logging options.

commit.message:
Issue #4683 Fix jetty-slf4j-impl for osgi

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

nodes.bodyText: Keep in mind that slf4j-api is <scope>compile</scope> by default, that means this change made it go from test to compile for this project.

FYI, this dependency (jetty-slf4j-impl) is declared at the top level pom.xml with both a version and scope.
(This is just a comment, no change is being asked for)
Why can't this use a jetty-logging.properties file instead?

commit.message:
Issue #4683 Use jetty-logging.properties for osgi tests

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #4683 Update README.txt

Signed-off-by: Jan Bartel <janb@webtide.com>

Issue #4683 - cleaning up pom for clarity

Signed-off-by: Joakim Erdfelt <joakim.erdfelt@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't the start of Servlet range be 4.0?
